snippet: A variety of factors is behind the price drop, analysts say, but OPEC’s decision on Friday not to tinker with its output, which is now at near-record levels, sent prices into a collapse.
abstract: Crude oil prices fall another 5 percent to their lowest levels since 2009 recession as OPEC, led by Saudi Arabia, refuses to cut production; American benchmark oil price is $38 per barrel, making drilling and completing wells a money-losing operation.
lead_paragraph: A variety of factors is behind the price drop, analysts say, but OPEC’s decision on Friday not to tinker with its output, which is now at near-record levels, sent prices into a collapse.

headline.main: Oil Prices Plunge 5% After OPEC Stands Pat
headline.print_headline: Oil Prices Plunge 5% After OPEC Stands Pat

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries
